title: SHELF CONFIGURATION COMMAND
description:
This command allows the operator to configure the shelf. The operator can 
configure the following parameters:
  - class: the classification of the shelf. The following shelf classes are 
supported:
    -- main-ethernet: supports Ethernet-based traffic. Shelves in this class 
can contain NT and LT units. There must be at least one shelf of this class in 
the system.
    -- ext-ethernet: supports Ethernet-based traffic. Shelves in this class can 
only contain LT units.
  - planned-type: the type planned for this shelf. The not-planned parameter 
indicates that a shelf will not be inserted at this position.
  - lock: locks or unlocks the shelf.
  - shelf-mode: the shelf mode. When the shelf mode was changed successfully, 
the NE will reboot automatically.
  - description: text that describes the location of the shelf.
user_level:
The command can be accessed by operators with equipment privileges, and 
executed by operators with equipment privileges.
syntax: > configure equipment shelf (index) [ no class | class <Equipm::ShelfClass> ] [ no planned-type | planned-type <Equipm::ShelfType> ] [ [ no ] lock ] [ [ no ] extended-lt-slots ] [ no mode | mode <Equipm::HolderMode> ] [ no description | description <Description-127> ]

resource_parameters.name: (index)
resource_parameters.description: the physical identification of the shelf

command_parameters.name: [no] class
command_parameters.description: the class to which the shelf belongs optional parameter with default value: "main-ethernet"
values: main-ethernet         : main shelf - supports ethernet-based traffic
ext-ethernet          : extension shelf - supports ethernet-based traffic

command_parameters.name: [no] planned-type
command_parameters.description: the planned type of the shelf optional parameter with default value: "not-planned"
command_parameters.format: Data driven field type                            Possible values are depending on the actual configuration and software.                            The currently allowed values can be shown with online-help.

command_parameters.name: [no] lock
command_parameters.description: the holder is locked optional parameter

command_parameters.name: [no] extended-lt-slots
command_parameters.description: change to extended lt slots obsolete parameter replaced by parameter "mode"

command_parameters.name: [no] mode
command_parameters.description: the shelf mode, applicable to NEP and ARAM-E only optional parameter with default value: "no-extended-lt-slots"
command_parameters.format: ( no-extended-lt-slots                            | extended-lt-slots                            | no-ntb-slot                            | no-extended-slots                            | no-ntio-slots                            | ngpon                            | gpon                            | ngpon-port-reduced                            | gpon-mng-ngpon                            | gpon-mng-reduced )
values: extended-lt-slots     : change to extended lt slots
no-ntb-slot           : use ntb slot as lt slot
ngpon                 : use universal ngpon lt (supports NG-PON2, XGS-PON and XG-PON1 currently)
ngpon-port-reduced    : use ngpon port reduced mode lt (supports ERPS)
gpon-mng-ngpon        : use gpon managed ngpon management model
gpon-mng-reduced      : use gpon managed ngpon port reduced mode lt(supports ERPS)

command_parameters.name: [no] description
command_parameters.description: any description to be used by the operator optional parameter with default value: "" - description to help the operator to identify the object - length: x<=127

raw:
help configure equipment shelf
SHELF CONFIGURATION COMMAND
===========================

Command Description
-------------------

This command allows the operator to configure the shelf. The operator can 
configure the following parameters:
  - class: the classification of the shelf. The following shelf classes are 
supported:
    -- main-ethernet: supports Ethernet-based traffic. Shelves in this class 
can contain NT and LT units. There must be at least one shelf of this class in 
the system.
    -- ext-ethernet: supports Ethernet-based traffic. Shelves in this class can 
only contain LT units.
  - planned-type: the type planned for this shelf. The not-planned parameter 
indicates that a shelf will not be inserted at this position.
  - lock: locks or unlocks the shelf.
  - shelf-mode: the shelf mode. When the shelf mode was changed successfully, 
the NE will reboot automatically.
  - description: text that describes the location of the shelf.


User Level
----------

The command can be accessed by operators with equipment privileges, and 
executed by operators with equipment privileges.

Command Syntax
--------------

The command has the following syntax:
> configure equipment shelf (index) [ no class | class <Equipm::ShelfClass> ] [ 
no planned-type | planned-type <Equipm::ShelfType> ] [ [ no ] lock ] [ [ no ] 
extended-lt-slots ] [ no mode | mode <Equipm::HolderMode> ] [ no description | 
description <Description-127> ]

Command Parameters
------------------

Table "Shelf Configuration Command" Resource Parameters

Resource Identifier        Description

(index)                    the physical identification of the shelf

Table "Shelf Configuration Command" Command Parameters

Parameter                  Description

[no] class                 the class to which the shelf belongs
                           optional parameter with default value: 
"main-ethernet"

                           Parameter type: <Equipm::ShelfClass>
                           Format:
                           ( main-ethernet
                           | ext-ethernet )
                           Possible values:
                           - main-ethernet         : main shelf - supports 
ethernet-based traffic
                           - ext-ethernet          : extension shelf - supports 
ethernet-based traffic

[no] planned-type          the planned type of the shelf
                           optional parameter with default value: "not-planned"

                           Parameter type: <Equipm::ShelfType>
                           Format:
                           Data driven field type
                           Possible values are depending on the actual 
configuration and software.
                           The currently allowed values can be shown with 
online-help.

[no] lock                  the holder is locked
                           optional parameter

                           Parameter type: boolean
                           

[no] extended-lt-slots     change to extended lt slots
                           obsolete parameter replaced by parameter "mode"

                           Parameter type: boolean
                           

[no] mode                  the shelf mode, applicable to NEP and ARAM-E only
                           optional parameter with default value: 
"no-extended-lt-slots"

                           Parameter type: <Equipm::HolderMode>
                           Format:
                           ( no-extended-lt-slots
                           | extended-lt-slots
                           | no-ntb-slot
                           | no-extended-slots
                           | no-ntio-slots
                           | ngpon
                           | gpon
                           | ngpon-port-reduced
                           | gpon-mng-ngpon
                           | gpon-mng-reduced )
                           Possible values:
                           - no-extended-lt-slots  : no extended lt slots
                           - extended-lt-slots     : change to extended lt slots
                           - no-ntb-slot           : use ntb slot as lt slot
                           - no-extended-slots     : no extended slots
                           - no-ntio-slots         : not changeable
                           - ngpon                 : use universal ngpon lt 
(supports NG-PON2, XGS-PON and XG-PON1 currently)
                           - gpon                  : use gpon lt
                           - ngpon-port-reduced    : use ngpon port reduced 
mode lt (supports ERPS)
                           - gpon-mng-ngpon        : use gpon managed ngpon 
management model
                           - gpon-mng-reduced      : use gpon managed ngpon 
port reduced mode lt(supports ERPS)

[no] description           any description to be used by the operator
                           optional parameter with default value: ""

                           Parameter type: <Description-127>
                           Format:
                           - description to help the operator to identify the 
object
                           - length: x<=127 


DS-LIN-TEST-01:automationuser>#
